content:
• Wednesday, May 23, 2018
  • AGNC

    AGNC -1.8% with offering said to come at $18.60-$18.80/share

    • AGNC Investment (NASDAQ:AGNC) is down 1.8% in postmarket trading after a 30M-share offering is said to come in at $18.60-$18.80/share.
    • That's a discount of about 2-3% from the close, Bloomberg reports; AGNC wrapped up the day at $19.18.
    • Shares are up 2% over the past month.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM | 13 Comments
  • EIGR

    Eiger Bio -5% with $40M offering said to come at $12.50/share

    • Eiger BioPharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EIGR) is 5% lower postmarket after a planned stock offering is said to come in at $12.50/share.
    • The company will sell $40M worth of shares at that price, Bloomberg reports. Shares closed today at $13.95, implying a 10.4% discount.
    • The company plans to use proceeds for funding its planned Phase 3 clinical trial of lonafarnib in Hepatitis Delta Virus infection, regulatory development of lonafarnib related to the treatment of Hutchison-Gilford Progeria Syndrome, and for general purposes.
    • Shares are up 40% over the past month.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • MRNS

    Marinus +8.8% with Baird bullish on 'blockbuster' drug potential

    • Marinus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MRNS) is up 8.8% postmarket, following a Baird initiation at Outperform.
    • Analyst Brian Skorney sees almost triple upside with a $15 price target against today's close of $5.23, and says the mechanism of neurosuppression in Marinus' lead drug candidate, ganaxolone, has "blockbuster potential."
    • He writes that the drug is similar to the brexanolone and SAGE-217 that led Sage Therapeutics to more than double over the past year "in every way but market valuation." (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Shares are up 347% over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • CMCSA

    Fox activist urges Murdoch to engage with Comcast on asset deal

    • With Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) confirming today that it's closing in on a cash bid for Fox (FOX, FOXA) media assets, Fox activist investor Chris Hohn says he'll back Comcast's bid over the $52.4B rival offer from Disney (NYSE:DIS).
    • In a letter to Rupert Murdoch, Hohn revealed an unexpectedly large 7.4% stake in Fox and dismissed regulatory risk that might rise from a Comcast/Fox deal, The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • He wants Murdoch and company to engage with Comcast on an offer. It's widely assumed that a superior rival offer for the Fox media assets came from Comcast earlier this spring, but that Fox preferred the lower regulatory risk of selling to Disney.
    • And again, much depends competitively on the outcome of the AT&T (NYSE:T)/Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) trial; Comcast today wants to send a message to take its bid seriously so shareholder votes aren't rushed before the June 12 outcome of the antitrust trial.
    • In action today: CMCSA -1.9%; FOX +1.3%; FOXA +1.6%; DIS -1.1%; T-0.3%; TWX -0.5%.
    • After hours: CMCSA +0.4%; FOXA +1.2%; DIS -0.1%; T -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 64 Comments
  • DEST

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/23/2018)

    • Top gainers: DEST +25.0%. BW +15.9%. WSM +15.2%. SMRT +10.9%. LASR +4.1%.
    • Top Losers: LB -5.6%. EIGR -5.1%.  WMLP-OLD -4.8%. NTAP -4.4%. PDS -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • QUIK

    QuickLogic -3.1% on public offering plans

    • QuickLogic (NASDAQ:QUIK) announces it intends to offer and sell shares of common stock and corresponding warrants in a public offering.
    • Company plans to use the net proceeds from the offering for working capital and product development.   
    • QuickLogic shares are down 3.1% aftermarket to $1.51.   
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 11 Comments
  • BW

    Babcock & Wilcox +16% after buyout offer from Steel Partners Holdings

    • Babcock & Wilcox (NYSE:BW) +16% after-hours as Steel Partners Holdings discloses it is prepared to acquire all shares it does not currently own for a price in the range of $3.00-3.50 in cash.
    • SPLP says its proposal is based upon the acquisition of the entire company, including BW's MEGTEC and Universal businesses.
    • SPLP says it currently owns a 17.8% stake in BW, according to SEC Form 13D.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 9 Comments
  • AGNC

    AGNC Investment hits capital raise button; shares down 1.15%

    • The company is selling 30M shares, with underwriter an greenshoe option for another 4.5M.
    • April 30 tangible book value was reported at $18.58 per share. Today's close was a modest premium at $19.18.
    • AGNC -1.15% after hours to $18.96.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 25 Comments
  • LB

    Weak guidance sends L Brands lower

    • L Brands (NYSE:LB) falls sharply after setting profit guidance below expectations.
    • The retailer expects Q2 EPS of $0.30 to $0.35 vs. $0.40 consensus and FY19 EPS of $2.70 to $3.00 vs $3.01 consensus.
    • LB -6.52% AH to $31.83.
    • Previously: L Brands misses by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 59 Comments
  • SNPS

    Synopsys +1.8% on Q2 beat, upside guidance

    • Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) gains 1.8% aftermarket on Q2 results that beat revenue estimates with a 14% Y/Y growth and met on EPS. Upside Q3 guidance has revenue from $760M to $785M (consensus: $700.57M) and EPS form $0.89 to $0.93 (consensus: $0.78). 
    • Upside FY18 guidance has revenue from $3.07B to $3.10B (consensus: $2.94B) and EPS from $3.76 to $3.83 (consensus: $3.72).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.        
    • Previously: Synopsys EPS in-line, beats on revenue (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • EIGR

    Eiger Bio readies stock offering

    • Eiger BioPharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EIGR) initiates a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma beats by $0.09, beats on revenue

    • Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q1 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $1.2B (+8.1% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
    • Shares +6.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 18 Comments
  • NTAP

    NetApp -3.4% despite Q4 beats, in-line guidance

    • NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) drops 3.4% on Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with an 11% Y/Y revenue growth. In-line Q1 guidance has revenue from $1.365B to $1.465B (consensus: $1.42B) and EPS from $0.76 to $0.82 (consensus: $0.78). FY19 guidance has mid-single digit revenue growth.
    • Key metrics: Cash from operations, $494M (+$129M Y/Y); cash and equivalents, $5.4B; capital allocation, $397M; operating expenses, $735M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: NetApp beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (May 23)
    • Previously: NetApp declares $0.40 dividend (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMRT

    Stein Mart reports Q1 results

    • Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT): Q1 EPS of $0.16
    • Revenue of $326.69M (-3.2% Y/Y)
    • Shares +12.19%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 22 Comments
  • HPE

    HPE closes -10.6% on "challenging second half" comment

    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) shares closed today down 10.6% after CEO Antonio Neri warned of a “challenging second half” of the year.
    • Neri: “We expect the growth rate to moderate. While we see a more challenging second half, we have got great momentum, and I’m confident that we can deliver on our annual fiscal year 2018 outlook.” 
    • Earnings call transcript.       
    • Previously: Hewlett Packard Enterprise reports Q2 beats, 10% rev. growth, upside FY guide (May 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • BGC

    General Cable +2.2%; DOJ says not investigating

    • Bloomberg is reporting the DOJ as saying General Cable (BGC +2.2%) is not under investigation.
    • Previously: General Cable responds to alleged investigation (May 23)
    • Previously: General Cable slumps 4% on report of government probe (May 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • AEE

    Ameren +2% as Goldman upgrades from Sell on bright Union Electric outlook

    • Ameren (AEE +2.1%) is higher after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Neutral from Sell with a $61 price target, raised from $55, at Goldman Sachs, which raises its estimates above consensus through 2021, particularly in 2020, because of an improved outlook at Union Electric.
    • Goldman foresees AEE's earnings rising 10% Y/Y in 2020 as 700 MW of wind generation gets added to Union Electric's rate base, which the firm says will mean an improved valuation relative to peers.
    • Earlier this week, AEE unveiled plans to build a 400 MW wind farm in Missouri, the state largest such project.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • GE

    GE -7.5% as Flannery makes no promises about 2019 dividend

    • General Electric (GE -7.5%) shares extend already sizable losses that were the result of company guidance that warned of continued weakness in its power business and reaffirmed targets for 2018 earnings and free cash flow.
    • But the large loss turned into the stock's biggest daily percentage decline since John Flannery became CEO last August after he failed to guarantee GE's 2019 dividend, saying instead that "we have to see how this plays out."
    • Following up on recent speculation about the dividend, Barclays analyst Julian Mitchell asked Flannery if he could "stand behind the $0.48 dividend in 2019."
    • “It’s ultimately a function of the free cash flow of the company and that’s ultimately a function of operating performance and things that we do with the portfolio,” Flannery said at the annual Electrical Products Group conference in Florida.
    • “The primary takeaway is the dividend will be cut as assets are sold,” says Vertical Research analyst Jeff Sprague. “Proceeds from sales have to go to debt reduction. Cash flow from assets sold is obviously gone, making [the] dividend unsustainable.”
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 110 Comments
  • CASY

    Jana denies Casey's General Stores report

    • Shares of Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY) are now only up 1.42% after Jana Partners tells CNBC that it doesn't own a single share of the retailer.
    • The original report sent shares of Casey's up over 7% before the bubble was burst.
    • Previously: Jana Partners reported to have stake in Casey's General Stores (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • AGR

    Avangrid-backed project wins 800 MW wind farm offshore Massachusetts

    • Avangrid (AGR +2.4%) jumps after Massachusetts utilities officials select Vineyard Wind to build an 800 MW wind farm off the coast of Martha's Vineyard, beating two competitors.
    • The selection is contingent upon successful negotiations of a contract with Vineyard Wind, a 50-50 joint venture with Avangrid Renewables and Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners.
    • Vineyard Wind beat out competing proposals from Deepwater Wind and Bay State Wind, which was a partnership between Danish firm Orsted (OTCPK:DNNGY) and Eversource (ES -2.3%); Deepwater Wind is chosen to develop a separate 400 MW offshore wind farm for Rhode Island.
    • Construction of Vineyard Wind's project is expected to begin in 2019 with the turbines becoming operational by 2021.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • OGEN

    Oragenics nabs U.S. patent covering Lantibiotics; shares up 33%

    • Nano cap Oragenics (OGEN +32.5%) jumps on a 5x surge in volume in response to its announcement that the USPTO has awarded it and The Texas A&M University System U.S. Patent No. 9,964,488 covering the composition of Lantibiotics and methods of use.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • BDR

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 PM (05/23/2018)

    • Gainers: BDR +18%. USAT +14%. KONE +12%. JCS +12%. BBOX +11%.
    • Losers: OTCPK:RNVA -17%. IGLD -12%. FTR -11%. HPE -11%. FTRPR -9%.

  • AEL

    American Equity Investment confirms it's in talks

    • American Equity Investment Life (AEL +8.4%) confirms that it's in preliminary talks regarding a potential transaction.
    • The company said it can't assure that the talks will continue or that any definitive agreement will be reached.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: American Equity up nearly 8% on sale chatter (May 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple Watch shipments up as wearables grow 35% in Q1

    • Shipments of wearables like the Apple (AAPL +0.1%) Watch grew 35% in Q1, according to Canalys data.
    • Apple shipped 3.8M Watches in the period, narrowly beating out Xiaomi’s (XI) 3.7M.
    • Apple and Xiaomi each held 18% of the wearable band shipments in the quarter.
    • The rest of the top 5 by market share: Fitbit (FIT -0.8%), 11%; Garmin (GRMN -0.4%), 7%; Huawei, 6%.
    • Smartwatches accounted for 43% of the wearable band market with the rest consisting of basic bands.
    • Previously: TSMC will reportedly produce two MicroLED panels for Apple Watch, AR device (April 3)
    • Update: Post updated to correct headline, intro sentence.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 83 Comments
  • ARLP

    Alliance Resource upgraded to Buy at MKM on compelling valuation

    • Alliance Resource Partners (ARLP +1.6%) is higher after MKM Partners upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $22 price target, up from $21, saying units trade at 4.4x EV/EBITDA on 2018 estimates and 5x on 2019 estimates, near the bottom of their peer group
    • MKM cites a "good quarter with a guidance increase" as export expectations in FY 2018 rose to ~20% total sales for the year, adding that production of thermal coal in the Illinois Basin and coking coal out of Appalachia were strong.
    • The firm also notes the solid quarter came despite delayed shipments of 1.4M tons of coal due to weather-related transportation disruptions on the river system.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 7 Comments
  • LLEX

    Lilis Energy +9% on crude oil gathering agreement with Salt Creek Midstream

    • Lilis Energy (LLEX +8.8%) surges after announcing a crude oil gathering agreement with Salt Creek Midstream, which is developing a new regional pipeline system in Texas and New Mexico to a terminal in Winkler County, Tex., linking to long-haul downstream pipelines.
    • LLEX says it will provide its acreage dedication with no volume or capex commitments and Salt Creek will provide all capital for the oil gathering system, with construction expected to begin immediately and service set to start next year.
    • LLEX and Salt Creek also reach an option agreement paying Lilis for selected natural gas midstream services.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • WMLP-OLD

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (05/23/2018)

    • Gainers: WMLP-OLD +177%. SNES +20%. EGY +9%. LLEX +9%. BPT +8%.
    • Losers: GSM -8%. ECR -7%. VEDL -6%. TGB -6%. SBGL -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • LOW

    Ackman said to take stake in Lowe's

    • Pershing Square Capital Management teamed up with another activist investor to take a +$1B stake in Lowe's (LOW +9.9%), sources tell The Wall Street Journal.
    • Pershing founder Bill Ackman reportedly supports the decision of the company to bring in former J.C. Penney chief Marvin Ellison as CEO. Of course, Ackman lost a fortune with an ill-timed bet on former J.C. Penney CEO Ron Johnson.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 15 Comments
  • CRIS

    Curis continues selloff ahead of reverse split, down 14%

    • Curis (CRIS -13.7%) is down on 70% higher volume. Shares have sold off almost 25% since last week. Yesterday after the close, it announced a 1:5 reverse stock split to take effect on Tuesday, May 29.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • FOX

    ESPN confirms and details $1.5B UFC rights deal

    • ESPN (DIS -1%) has confirmed its five-year deal with the UFC, a pact that elbows out previous exclusive rights partner Fox Sports (FOX +1.8%, FOXA +2.1%) to make ESPN the UFC's new home.
    • The package costs $1.5B over five years, a substantial step up from Fox's payments.
    • In combination with an earlier deal, the package will encompass 30 Fight Night events (each with 12 bouts) each year, including 10 main cards on ESPN TV networks, with the other 20 streaming on ESPN Plus.
    • ESPN networks will also show preliminary bouts before 12 pay-per-view events in 2019.
    • WWE has legged up recently as the new deals are helping set a high price for its negotiations with Fox, jumping on SmackDown rights after NBCUniversal passed on its first rights.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 22 Comments
  • EBR

    Eletrobras -10% as privatization hopes fade

    • Eletrobras (EBR -10.1%) plunges ~10% after the head of Brazil's lower house of Congress said it would not vote on a presidential decree outlining rules for the sale of state-controlled power companies, instead asking Pres. Temer to send a draft bill.
    • The decision likely ends the planned privatization of the state-run power company and some of its subsidiaries for this year.
    • With Brazil's general election scheduled for October, the Congress likely will not have enough time to evaluate and vote on a new draft bill.
    • Shares of Petrobras (PBR -3.1%) also are sharply lower.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BZQ, UBR, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • YRIV

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (05/23/2018)

    • Losers: CWH -12%. XRF -8%. MFIN -6%. IBTX -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • WMLP-OLD

    Midday Gainers / Losers (05/23/2018)

    • Gainers: WMLP-OLD +172%. AVGR +53%. CARA +32%. BDR +28%. TIF +20%. RL +17%. OTC:MDXG +16%. AMDA +14%. USAT +13%. DCAR +13%.
    • Losers: FWP -30%. RRGB -19%. OTC:CDTI -19%. CMTA -16%. ARDX -14%. PFNX -15%. CWH -12%. ADOM -11%. TIS -11%. TCS -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • DISH

    Dish gives official launch to AirTV service

    • Dish DBS (DISH -2.5%) has given an official launch to AirTV, its over-the-top service to provide home and remote access to broadcast channels.
    • That allows customers to use the Sling TV app or AirTV app to see local broadcast channels on various devices at no additional charge; custoemrs only buy hardware that retails for just under $120.
    • It works with an existing Sling TV subscription but doesn't require one.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • GE

    GE -5% as Flannery sees no profit growth this year at power unit

    • General Electric (GE -5.4%) gives up more than a week's worth of gains after CEO John Flannery says he expects no profit growth in its power business this year and is planning for the market for heavy duty gas power turbines to remain weak through 2020, according to presentation slides for the 2018 Electrical Products Group Conference.
    • GE also reaffirms its targets for 2018 EPS of $1.00-$1.07 and free cash flow generation of $6B-$7B, and expects profit at its Baker Hughes (BHGE -0.7%) oil and gas unit to rise by 50% or more this year while forecasting profit rising 15% at the aviation business and 5% in healthcare.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 166 Comments
  • WDAY

    OTR Global downgrades Workday

    • OTR Global downgrades Workday (NYSE:WDAY) from Positive to Mixed.
    • Workday shares are down 1.8% to $128.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACRX

    Leerink-led investors acquire Three Arch stake in AcelRx; shares up 7%

    • AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX +6.9%) is up on average volume on the heels of its announcement that the ~9.4M shares owned by funds managed by Three Arch Partners have been acquired by investors led by Leerink Revelation Partners and Industry Ventures.
    • The Three Arch funds are in the process of dissolution.
    • CEO Vince Angotti says, "We welcome our new shareholders and are appreciative that Three Arch was able to agree to the sale of its position to long-term shareholders that understand the potential value in AcelRx. We remain on track to achieve the remaining key milestones this year, with the expectation of another approved product in Europe and our first approved product in the U.S. with DSUVIA."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 11 Comments
  • RL

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:05 PM (05/23/2018)

    • Gainers: RL +16%. SYPR +9%. OTIV +7%.
    • Losers: ADOM -12%. TIS -10%. THO -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNES

    SenesTech partners with Pestmaster

    • SenesTech (SNES +3.9%) and Pestmaster have developed a "rapid rollout plan" for the deployment of ContraPest in California, once approval of ContraPest is final.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • WPP

    Advertising stocks slide as Morgan Stanley sounds warning

    • Margins are already cycle-high for advertising sector firms, and adding in growth that lags GDP makes a warning bell for the stocks, Morgan Stanley says.
    • The giants -- WPP, Publicis Groupe (OTCQX:PUBGY), Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) and Omnicom (NYSE:OMC) -- look to be losing share in media spending, the firm says in a note. If the sector goes through a cyclical slowdown in 2019, then valuation multiples could re-test lows from late 2017, it says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • WPP today is down 4.7%; Publicis is off 2.7%; Interpublic Group is 2.5% lower (but closer to its 52-week high than its 52-week low); Omnicom is 4% lower.
    • Previously: WSJ: Omnicom takes HSBC media account from struggling WPP (May. 22 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • TXMD

    TherapeuticsMD shares halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in TherapeuticsMD (TXMD +2.2%) pending the release of news, most likely related to its U.S. marketing application for TX-004HR for dyspareunia (action date May 29).
    • Update: In a statement, the company says it has not received any communication from the FDA regarding its TX-004HR marketing application and still expects the announcement on May 29.
    • Update: Shares will resume trading at 1:10 pm ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 36 Comments
  • CRSP

    Trump set to sign "right to try" bill; biotechs rally

    • Many biotechs are in the green in early trade after the U.S. House of Representatives voted in favor of the Senate's version of "right to try" legislation yesterday. The bill, expected to be quickly signed into law by President Trump, will allow people with life-threatening illnesses to obtain unapproved drugs that have been vetted for safety in early-stage studies. In other words, the federal government will not interfere with a person's efforts to gain access to such a drug in this situation.
    • Critics say the law, which does not guarantee access the medications, will not have any appreciable effect on the status quo since supplies of investigational drugs are limited because developers earmark them for clinical trials.
    • Selected tickers: (CRSP +7.3%)(EDIT +4.8%)(NTLA +5.2%)(UTHR +1.6%)(PBYI +1.9%)(BMRN +2.2%)(BIIB +1.1%)(CELG +0.8%)(XBI +0.9%)(BIB +0.9%)(ADVM +2.5%)(ABEO +1.4%)(RCKT +1.5%)(QURE +9.4%)(VYGR +2.8%)(RARE +0.8%)(SGMO +2.2%)(ONCE +4.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 134 Comments
  • XPLT

    Xpel Technologies announces Q1 as the strongest quarter in company’s history

    • XPEL Technologies (OTC:XPLT +50.8%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 99.5% Y/Y & 24.5% Q/Q to $25.2M.
    • Gross margin improved 330 bps to 29.7% & EBITDA margin increased 905 bps to 12.3%.
    • S,G&A expenses increased to $4.9M (+48.5% Y/Y) which was 19.4% of revenue, this increase was due mainly to increases in personnel, occupancy, sales & marketing & information technology related costs to support the ongoing growth of the business.
    • Cash & equivalents of $3.4M (flat Q/Q).
    • “We remain focused on continuing to drive profitable growth as we expand our presence in both domestic & international markets, capture new customers & grow our market share,” said Mr. Ryan Pape, President & CEO.
    • Previously: Xpel Technologies reports Q1 results (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CMTA

    Clementia Pharma's palovarotene shows positive effect in mid-stage FOP study

    • Thinly traded small cap Clementia Pharmaceuticals (CMTA -17.6%) slumps on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 132K shares, in apparent reaction to its announcement of interim results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating palovarotene in patients with fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva (FOP), a rare genetic disorder in which muscle and connective tissue are gradually replaced by bone.
    • Treatment with palovarotene, a small molecule retinoic acid receptor gamma agonist, reduced new bone growths at flare-up sites by 91% at week 12 compared to placebo and untreated flare-up sites from the company's natural history study. In evaluable patients, those with no new bone growths at week 12 also had no new bone growths at month 12, signaling a sustained benefit.
    • A Phase 3 study, MOVE, is recruiting patients. The first data readout should happen in mid-2019.
    • Slide presentation
    • Previously: Clementia Pharma launches late-stage study of palovarotene in rare extra-skeletal bone disorder; shares up 2% (Dec. 12, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 5 Comments
  • AU

    AngloGold to cut 2K jobs as it shrinks South Africa footprint

    • AngloGold Ashanti (AU -2.1%) says it will cut as many as 2K jobs at its domestic South African operations as part a restructuring aimed at reducing losses.
    • AU, whose remaining South African assets are the Mponeng underground gold mine and a tailings treatment operation, says the move will affect employees across different categories and levels, including senior management.
    • AU currently employs ~8,200 people in South Africa, where mining companies are facing falling grades, rising costs, declining labor productivity and an uncertain regulatory environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 5 Comments
  • AVGR

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (05/23/2018)

    • Gainers: AVGR +40%. CARA +29%. HTBX +11%. CTXR +11%. GERN +11%.
    • Losers: FWP -17%. PFNX -15%. CMTA -14%. ARDX -14%. NVIV -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • WLBAQ

    Westmoreland Coal +28% after securing $110M in new financing

    • Westmoreland Coal (WLBA +28%) and Westmoreland Resource Partners (WMLP-OLD +173.1%) skyrocket after announcing a new $110M financing commitment from a group of existing secured creditors holding ~79% of its term loan and 79% of its senior secured notes.
    • WLB says the financing will provide additional liquidity and will fully repay both the San Juan term loan and the existing asset-based revolvers, simplifying its capital structure.

  • ESPR

    Esperion Therapeutics halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Esperion Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ESPR) pending the release of news.
    • Update: The company's bempedoic acid was successful in the third of five pivotal Phase 3 studies (Study 3 or 1002-046). High-risk patients with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) or at high-risk for ASCVD with hypercholesterolemia (elevated blood cholesterol) inadequately controlled with maximally tolerated background therapy experienced significant lowering of LDL-C ("bad" cholesterol) after 12 weeks of treatment.
    • The study met the primary endpoint of demonstrating a statistically significant reduction in LDL-C versus placebo at week 12. Specifically, patients in the treatment group showed a 23% drop in bad cholesterol compared to a decrease of 1% for placebo (p<0.001). At week 24, bempidoic acid also demonstrated its superiority to control with a 26% reduction in LDL-C versus 2% for placebo.
    • Patients in the treatment group experienced a 25% reduction in C-reactive protein, an inflammation biomarker, compared to an increase of 3% for control (p<0.001).
    • Complete results will be submitted for presentation at an upcoming medical conference.
    • Shares are up 2% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 4 Comments
  • RMTI

    Rockwell Medical announces CEO transition; shares ahead 9% premarket

    • Rockwell Medical (NASDAQ:RMTI) announces that its Board of Directors has formed a Special Transition Committee to provide board-level oversight over the strategic direction and day-to-day operations. The Committee will comprise independent directors Ben Wolin, Lisa Colleran and John Cooper.
    • Also, the Company's President and CEO, Robert Chioini, has been terminated from his positions, effective immediately. Mr. Chioini has also resigned as a member of the Board. A formal search process to identify a permanent CEO is initiated.
    • Shares are up 9% premarket.
    • Update: In a statement issued by the company on behalf of Mr. Chioini, he stated that he called an emergency board meeting yesterday to address a shareholder demand letter requesting an independent investigation into alleged breaches of fiduciary duties and possible violations of securities and other laws by certain directors. The directors under question voted to fire him but the non-conflicted directors believed that the vote was not effective since the action was not the purpose of the special meeting. As such, he will continue to serve as CEO consistent with his employment contract. The internal investigation is proceeding under the direction of two non-conflicted directors. Also, contrary to an announcement from the Chairman, CFO Thomas Klema has not been terminated and continues to fulfill his responsibilities.

  • MDT

    Medtronic's Symplicity Spyral system shows treatment effect in hypertension study; shares up 1% premarket

    • Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) is up 1% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive preliminary results from the SPYRAL HTN-ON MED study evaluating its Symplicity Spyral renal denervation (RDN) system in patients with high blood pressure receiving anti-hypertension medications. The data were presented at EuroPCR in Paris and published in The Lancet.
    • At month 6, patients receiving treatment with Symplicity Spyral experienced an average reduction in 24-hour mean systolic (blood pressure during contraction of the heart) ambulatory blood pressure (ABPM) of 9 mm Hg, 7.4 mm Hg greater than sham control (p=0.005). The reduction in diastolic (blood pressure between heart beats) ABPM was 6.0 mm Hg, 4.1 mm Hg greater than sham control (p=0.029).
    • The positive results represent a win for the company. An earlier study, SYMPLICITY HTN-3, failed to achieve the primary endpoint.
    • Renal denervation is a minimally invasive catheter-based procedure that regulates the over-activity of nerves leading to and from the kidney which helps to lower blood pressure in patients inadequately controlled with medication.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 AM
